item.title: Data types in R
item.description: What data types exist in R? Numeric Integer Character Logical This article presents the different data types in R. To learn about the different variable types from a statistical point of view, read “Variable types and examples”. What data types exist in R? There are five data types in R: Numeric Integer Complex Character Logical Datasets in R are often a combination of these 5 different data types.

item.title: About
item.description: Hello, my name is Antoine Soetewey. I am a PhD student in statistics at UCLouvain (Belgium). My research interests focus on survival analysis and bio-statistical procedures applied to cancer patients. In parallel with my doctoral thesis, I am teaching assistant for several courses in statistics and probability at bachelor and master’s level. I also provide trainings and workshops in statistics and R in a belgian consulting company. For more information about myself please visit www.

item.title: Hello World!
item.description: This is the first post for the blog Stats and R, just to introduce it. This blog aims at helping academics (mainly students) and professionals (working with data) to grasp important concepts in statistics and to apply them in R. Thanks in advance for reading. As always, if you find a mistake/bug or if you have any questions do not hesitate to let me know in the comment section of the corresponding article, raise an issue on GitHub or contact me.
